title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'Then we sailed away for England, and the boats fell astern.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Now the ship 'Adventuress' was to sail on the third day of June.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

text: were made, and yet that was the one I most wished to make. Since the day
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: at my mother's burial, and then we had not spoken. Now it seemed that I
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: return, and bid her no goodbye. In my grief and perplexity I spoke to my
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: father, telling him how the matter stood and asking his help.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'I go hence,' I said, 'to avenge our common loss, and if need be to give
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: not for you, Thomas,' he answered; 'and a man may do what he wills with
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: from his door. Bid them bring horses, and we will ride to the Hall.'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Within the half of an hour we were there, and my father asked for speech
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: with its master. The serving man looked at me askance, remembering his
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: orders, still he ushered us into the justice room where the Squire sat
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: drinking ale.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'Good morrow to you, neighbour,' said the Squire; 'you are welcome here,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: but you bring one with you who is not welcome, though he be your son.'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'I bring him for the last time, friend Bozard. Listen to his request,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: then grant it or refuse it as you will; but if you refuse it, it will
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: not bind us closer. The lad rides to-night to take ship for Spain to
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: seek that man who murdered his mother. He goes of his own free will
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: because after the doing of the deed it was he who unwittingly suffered
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: the murderer to escape, and it is well that he should go.'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'He is a young hound to run such a quarry to earth, and in a strange
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: country,' said the Squire. 'Still I like his spirit and wish him well.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'Leave to bid farewell to your daughter. I know that his suit does not
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: please you and cannot wonder at it, and for my own part I think it too

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: already. Now for your answer.'

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Squire Bozard thought a while, then said:
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'The lad is a brave lad though he shall be no son-in-law of mine. He
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: is going far, and mayhap will return no more, and I do not wish that
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: he should think unkindly of me when I am dead. Go without, Thomas
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: my mind.'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: So I went and waited under the beech with a beating heart, and presently
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Lily glided up to me, a more welcome sight to my eyes than any angel out
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: of heaven. And, indeed, I doubt if an angel could have been more fair
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: than she, or more good and gentle.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'Oh! Thomas,' she whispered, when I had greeted her, 'is this true that
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: you sail oversea to seek the Spaniard?'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'I sail to seek the Spaniard, and to find him and to kill him when he
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: is found. It was to come to you, Lily, that I let him go, now I must let
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: you go to come to him. Nay, do not weep, I have sworn to do it, and were
title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: am a wife? You go and I shall never see you more.'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'Who can say, my sweet? My father went over seas and came back safe,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: having passed through many perils.'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'Yes, he came back and--not alone. You are young, Thomas, and in far
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: countries there are ladies great and fair, and how shall I hold my own
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: in your heart against them, I being so far away?'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'Nay, Thomas, swear no oaths lest you should add to your sins by
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: breaking them. Yet, love, forget me not, who shall forget you never.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: the earth. If so, then we must hope to meet in heaven. At the least
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: while my father lives, and may he live long!'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: feet to meet them.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'Senor,' said the tallest of them in a soft and gentle voice, 'suffer
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Did I still dream, or did I know the voice? Now for the first time I
title: Montezuma's Daughter

text: could see the man's face--it was that of JUAN DE GARCIA! But if I knew
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'Caramba!' he said, 'whom have we here? Senor Thomas Wingfield I salute
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: you. Look, my comrades, you see this young man whom the sea has brought
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: to us. He is no Spaniard but an English spy. The last time that I saw
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: because I threatened to reveal his trade to the authorities. Now he is
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: here, upon what errand he knows best.'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'It is false,' I answered; 'I am no spy, and I am come to these seas for
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: one purpose only--to find you.'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'Then you have succeeded well, too well for your own comfort, perhaps.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Say now, do you deny that you are Thomas Wingfield and an Englishman?'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'I do not deny it. I--'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'Your pardon. How comes it then that, as your companion the priest tells
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: me, you sailed in Las Cinque Llagas under the name of D'AILA?'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'For my own reasons, Juan de Garcia.'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'You are confused, senor. My name is Sarceda, as these gentlemen can
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: bear me witness. Once I knew a cavalier of the name of de Garcia, but he
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: is dead.'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'You lie,' I answered; whereon one of De Garcia's companions struck me
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: across the mouth.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'Gently, friend,' said de Garcia; 'do not defile your hand by striking
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: such rats as this, or if you must strike, use a stick. You have
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: heard that he confesses to passing under a false name and to being an
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Englishman, and therefore one of our country's foes. To this I add
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: upon my word of honour that to my knowledge he is a spy and a would-be
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: murderer. Now, gentlemen, under the commission of his majesty's
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: representative, we are judges here, but since you may think that, having
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: unjustly with him, I prefer to leave the matter in your hands.'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Now I tried to speak once more, but the Spaniard who had struck me, a
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: ferocious-looking villain, drew his sword and swore that he would run me
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: through if I dared to open my lips. So I thought it well to keep silent.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'This Englishman would grace a yardarm very well,' he said.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: De Garcia, who had begun to hum a tune indifferently, smiled, looking
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: first at the yard and then at my neck, and the hate in his eyes seemed
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: to burn me.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'I have a better thought than that,' said the third officer. 'If we hung
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: him questions might be asked, and at the least, it would be a waste of
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: good money. He is a finely built young man and would last some years in
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: him myself at a valuation. I am in want of a few such on my estate.'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: At these words I saw de Garcia's face fall a little, for he wished to
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: beyond saying with a slight yawn:
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'So far as I am concerned, take him, comrade, and free of cost. Only I
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: warn you, watch him well or you will find a stiletto in your back.'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: quarters. And now, Englishman, there is room for you below I think;'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: of my possessions--fetters were placed upon my ankles and round my neck,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: various signs what was the cargo of this ship. She was laden with slaves
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: captured in Fernandina, as the Spaniards name the island of Cuba, that
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: were to be sold in Hispaniola. Among these slaves I was now numbered.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: more than seven feet in height, and the slaves lay ironed in the bilge
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: water on the bottom of the vessel. They were crowded as thick as they
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: could lie, being chained to rings fixed in the sides of the ship.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Altogether there may have been two hundred of them, men, women and
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: children, or rather there had been two hundred when the ship sailed a
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: week before. Now some twenty were dead, which was a small number, since
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: the Spaniards reckon to lose from a third to half of their cargo in this
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: devilish traffic. When I entered the place a deadly sickness seized me,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: weak as I was, brought on by the horrible sounds and smells, and the
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: of black men and women, many feet resting in the bilge water. There the
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Spaniards left me with a jeer, saying that this was too good a bed
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: given, standing near me with a lantern and directing the removal of the
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: escape from the sickness to the fact that the largest opening in the
title: Montezuma's Daughter

text: deck was made directly above my head, so that by standing up, which my
title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: drank greedily of the water, but the cakes I could not eat, for they
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: not try to write of them.

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: I could stand no longer in that cramped posture, I saw a woman's dress
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: pass by the hole in the deck, and knew it for one that was worn by a
title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: She started, then as the priest had done, she sat herself down upon the
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: deck, and I told her of my dreadful plight, not knowing that she was
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: acquainted with it, and of the horrors below.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'Where is the priest?' I asked.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: And now I will tell how it was that I came to be saved from the knife.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: in a bark of serpents' skins.  But before he sailed he
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: and suffered to wander where I would, though always under the care of
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: guards who, had I escaped, would have paid for it with their lives. I
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: the more I studied this people the less I could understand of them. In
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: This was Guatemoc, Montezuma's nephew, and afterwards the last emperor
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: of Anahuac. So soon as I saw him I saluted him in the Indian fashion by
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: touching the earth with my right hand, which I then raised to my head.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: But Guatemoc, having scanned me with his eye as I stood, bow in hand,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: attired in my simple hunter's dress, smiled frankly and said:
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'Surely, Teule, if I know anything of the looks of men, we are too equal
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: in our birth, as in our age, for you to salute me as a slave greets his
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: master.' And he held his hand to me.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: I took it, answering with the help of Marina, who was watching this
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: great lord with eager eyes.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'It may be so, prince, but though in my own country I am a man of repute
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: and wealth, here I am nothing but a slave snatched from the sacrifice.'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'I know it,' he said frowning. 'It is well for all here that you were so
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: snatched before the breath of life had left you, else Montezuma's wrath
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: had fallen on this city.' And he looked at the cacique who trembled,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: such in those days was the terror of Montezuma's name.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Then he asked me if I was a Teule or Spaniard. I told him that I was
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: no Spaniard but one of another white race who had Spanish blood in his
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: veins. This saying seemed to puzzle him, for he had never so much as
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: heard of any other white race, so I told him something of my story, at
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: least so much of it as had to do with my being cast away.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: When I had finished, he said, 'If I have understood aright, Teule, you
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: say that you are no Spaniard, yet that you have Spanish blood in you,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: and came hither in a Spanish ship, and I find this story strange. Well,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: it is for Montezuma to judge of these matters, so let us talk of them no
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: more. Come and show me how you handle that great bow of yours. Did you
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: bring it with you or did you fashion it here? They tell me, Teule, that
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: there is no such archer in the land.'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: So I came up and showed him the bow which was of my own make, and would
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: shoot an arrow some sixty paces further than any that I saw in Anahuac,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: and we fell into talk on matters of sport and war, Marina helping out my
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: want of language, and before that day was done we had grown friendly.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: For a week the prince Guatemoc and his company rested in the town of
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Tobasco, and all this time we three talked much together. Soon I saw
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: that Marina looked with eyes of longing on the great lord, partly
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: because of his beauty rank and might, and partly because she wearied of
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: her captivity in the house of the cacique, and would share Guatemoc's
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: power, for Marina was ambitious. She tried to win his heart in many
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: ways, but he seemed not to notice her, so that at last she spoke more
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: plainly and in my hearing.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'You go hence to-morrow, prince,' she said softly, 'and I have a favour
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: to ask of you, if you will listen to your handmaid.'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'Speak on, maiden,' he answered.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'I would ask this, that if it pleases you, you will buy me of the
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: cacique my master, or command him to give me up to you, and take me with
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: you to Tenoctitlan.'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Guatemoc laughed aloud. 'You put things plainly, maiden,' he said,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'but know that in the city of Tenoctitlan, my wife and royal cousin,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Tecuichpo, awaits me, and with her three other ladies, who as it chances
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: are somewhat jealous.'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Now Marina flushed beneath her brown skin, and for the first and last
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: time I saw her gentle eyes grow hard with anger as she answered:
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'I asked you to take me with you, prince; I did not ask to be your wife
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: or love.'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'But perchance you meant it,' he said dryly.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'Whatever I may have meant, prince, it is now forgotten. I wished to see
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: the great city and the great king, because I weary of my life here and
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: would myself grow great. You have refused me, but perhaps a time will
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: come when I shall grow great in spite of you, and then I may remember
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: the shame that has been put upon me against you, prince, and all your
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: royal house.'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Again Guatemoc laughed, then of a sudden grew stern.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'You are over-bold, girl,' he said; 'for less words than these many a
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: one might find herself stretched upon the stone of sacrifice. But I will
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: forget them, for your woman's pride is stung, and you know not what you
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: say. Do you forget them also, Teule, if you have understood.'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Then Marina turned and went, her bosom heaving with anger and outraged
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: love or pride, and as she passed me I heard her mutter, 'Yes, prince,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: you may forget, but I shall not.'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Often since that day I have wondered if some vision of the future
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: entered into the girl's breast in that hour, or if in her wrath she
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: spoke at random. I have wondered also whether this scene between her and
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Guatemoc had anything to do with the history of her after life; or did
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Marina, as she avowed to me in days to come, bring shame and ruin on
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: her country for the love of Cortes alone? It is hard to say, and perhaps
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: these things had nothing to do with what followed, for when great events
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: have happened, we are apt to search out causes for them in the past that
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: were no cause. This may have been but a passing mood of hers and one
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: soon put out of mind, for it is certain that few build up the temples
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: of their lives upon some firm foundation of hope or hate, of desire or
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: despair, though it has happened to me to do so, but rather take chance
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: for their architect--and indeed whether they take him or no, he is still
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: the master builder. Still that Marina did not forget this talk I know,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: for in after times I heard her remind this very prince of the words that
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: had passed between them, ay, and heard his noble answer to her.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Now I have but one more thing to tell of my stay in Tobasco, and then
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: let me on to Mexico, and to the tale of how Montezuma's daughter became
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: my wife, and of my further dealings with de Garcia.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: On the day of our departure a great sacrifice of slaves was held upon
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: the teocalli to propitiate the gods, so that they might give us a safe
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: journey, and also in honour of some festival, for to the festivals of
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: the Indians there was no end. Thither we went up the sides of the
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: steep pyramid, since I must look upon these horrors daily. When all was
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: heart, came forth from the sanctuary of the god Quetzal and signed to
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: his companions to stretch the first of the victims on the stone. Then
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: of a sudden the prince Guatemoc stepped forward, and addressing the
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: priests, pointed to their chief, and said:
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'Seize that man!'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: royal, to lay hands upon a high priest was sacrilege. Then with a smile
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: on which was engraved a strange device. With the ring he drew out also
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: stone, began to tremble and weep, for he did not desire to drink of his
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: own medicine.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'Why must I be offered up, O prince?' he cried, 'I who have been a
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: faithful servant to the gods and to the Emperor.'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: swordfish. Snatching it from its loop I gave the puma battle, striking a
title: Montezuma's Daughter

text: blow upon his head that rolled him over and caused the blood to pour.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: puma. In a second I was cast to the earth with a great shock, and the
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: brute was on me tearing and biting at my chest and neck. It was well for
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: torn, and to this day I bear the marks of the beast's claws upon my
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: body. But now when I seemed to be lost the great blow that I had struck
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: took effect on him, for one of the points of glass had pierced to his
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: brain. He lifted his head, his claws contracted themselves in my flesh,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: lay upon the ground unable to stir, for I was much hurt, until my
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: companions, having taken heart, came back and pulled the puma off me.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

text: lack of breath, had found his feet again.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: that I will always stand your friend to the death as you have stood
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: mine.'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Thus he spoke to me; but to the others he said nothing, casting no
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: reproaches at them.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: CHAPTER XV
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: THE COURT OF MONTEZUMA
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Now for a week I was so ill from my wounds that I was unable to be
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: moved, and then I must be carried in a litter till we came to within
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: three days' journey of the city of Tenoctitlan or Mexico. After that,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: as the roads were now better made and cared for than any I have seen in
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: England, I was able to take to my feet again. Of this I was glad, for
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: I have no love of being borne on the shoulders of other men after the
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: womanish Indian fashion, and, moreover, as we had now come to a cold
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: country, the road running through vast table-lands and across the tops
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: of mountains, it was no longer necessary as it had been in the hot
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: lands. Never did I see anything more dreary than these immense lengths
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: of desolate plains covered with aloes and other thorny and succulent
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: shrubs of fantastic aspect, which alone could live on the sandy and
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: waterless soil. This is a strange land, that can boast three separate
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: climates within its borders, and is able to show all the glories of the
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: tropics side by side with deserts of measureless expanse.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: One night we camped in a rest house, of which there were many built
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: along the roads for the use of travellers, that was placed almost on
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: the top of the sierra or mountain range which surrounds the valley of
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Tenoctitlan. Next morning we took the road again before dawn, for the
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: cold was so sharp at this great height that we, who had travelled from
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: the hot land, could sleep very little, and also Guatemoc desired if it
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: were possible to reach the city that night.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: When we had gone a few hundred paces the path came to the crest of the
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: mountain range, and I halted suddenly in wonder and admiration. Below
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: me lay a vast bowl of land and water, of which, however, I could see
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: nothing, for the shadows of the night still filled it. But before me,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: piercing the very clouds, towered the crests of two snow-clad mountains,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: and on these the light of the unrisen sun played, already changing their
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: whiteness to the stain of blood. Popo, or the Hill that Smokes, is the
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: name of the one, and Ixtac, or the Sleeping Woman, that of the other,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: and no grander sight was ever offered to the eyes of man than they
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: furnished in that hour before the dawn. From the lofty summit of Popo
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: went up great columns of smoke which, what with the fire in their heart
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: and the crimson of the sunrise, looked like rolling pillars of
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: flame. And for the glory of the glittering slopes below, that changed
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: continually from the mystery of white to dull red, from red to crimson,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: and from crimson to every dazzling hue that the rainbow holds, who can
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: tell it, who can even imagine it? None, indeed, except those that have
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: seen the sun rise over the volcans of Tenoctitlan.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: When I had feasted my eyes on Popo I turned to Ixtac. She is not so
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: lofty as her 'husband,' for so the Aztecs name the volcan Popo, and when
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: first I looked I could see nothing but the gigantic shape of a woman
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: fashioned in snow, and lying like a corpse upon her lofty bier, whose
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: hair streamed down the mountain side. But now the sunbeams caught her
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: also, and she seemed to start out in majesty from a veil of rosy mist,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: a wonderful and thrilling sight. But beautiful as she was then, still I
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: love the Sleeping Woman best at eve. Then she lies a shape of glory on
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: the blackness beneath, and is slowly swallowed up into the solemn night
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: as the dark draws its veil across her.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Now as I gazed the light began to creep down the sides of the volcans,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: revealing the forests on their flanks. But still the vast valley was
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: filled with mist that lay in dense billows resembling those of the sea,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: through which hills and temple tops started up like islands. By slow
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: degrees as we passed upon our downward road the vapours cleared away,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: and the lakes of Tezcuco, Chalco, and Xochicalco shone in the sunlight
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: like giant mirrors. On their banks stood many cities, indeed the
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: greatest of these, Mexico, seemed to float upon the waters; beyond them
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: and about them were green fields of corn and aloe, and groves of forest
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: trees, while far away towered the black wall of rock that hedges in the
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: valley.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: All day we journeyed swiftly through this fairy land. We passed through
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: the cities of Amaquem and Ajotzinco, which I will not stay to describe,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: and many a lovely village that nestled upon the borders of Lake Chalco.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Then we entered on the great causeway of stone built like a road resting
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: on the waters, and with the afternoon we came to the town of Cuitlahuac.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Thence we passed on to Iztapalapan, and here Guatemoc would have rested
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: for the night in the royal house of his uncle Cuitlahua. But when we
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: reached the town we found that Montezuma, who had been advised of
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: our approach by runners, had sent orders that we were to push on to
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Tenoctitlan, and that palanquins had been made ready to bear us. So we
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: entered the palanquins, and leaving that lovely city of gardens, were
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: borne swiftly along the southern causeway. On we went past towns built
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: upon piles fixed in the bottom of the lake, past gardens that were laid
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: out on reeds and floated over the waters like a boat, past teocallis and
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: glistening temples without number, through fleets of light canoes and
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: thousands of Indians going to and fro about their business, till at
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: length towards sunset we reached the battlemented fort that is called
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Xoloc which stands upon the dyke. I say stands, but alas! it stands no
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: more. Cortes has destroyed it, and with it all those glorious cities
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: which my eyes beheld that day.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: At Xoloc we began to enter the city of Tenoctitlan or Mexico, the
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: mightiest city that ever I had seen. The houses on the outskirts,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: indeed, were built of mud or adobe, but those in the richer parts were
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: constructed of red stone. Each house surrounded a courtyard and was
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: in turn surrounded by a garden, while between them ran canals, having
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: footpaths on either side. Then there were squares, and in the squares
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: pyramids, palaces, and temples without end. I gazed on them till I was
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: bewildered, but all seemed as nothing when at length I saw the great
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: temple with its stone gateways opening to the north and the south,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: the east and the west, its wall carven everywhere with serpents, its
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: polished pavements, its teocallis decked with human skulls, thousands
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: upon thousands of them, and its vast surrounding tianquez, or market
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: place. I caught but a glimpse of it then, for the darkness was falling,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: and afterwards we were borne on through the darkness, I did not know
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: whither.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: A while went by and I saw that we had left the city, and were passing
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: up a steep hill beneath the shadow of mighty cedar trees. Presently we
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: halted in a courtyard and here I was bidden to alight. Then the prince
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Guatemoc led me into a wondrous house, of which all the rooms were
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: roofed with cedar wood, and its walls hung with richly-coloured cloths,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: and in that house gold seemed as plentiful as bricks and oak are with
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: us in England. Led by domestics who bore cedar wands in their hands,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: we went through many passages and rooms, till at length we came to
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: a chamber where other domestics were awaiting us, who washed us with
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: scented waters and clothed us in gorgeous apparel. Thence they conducted
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: us to a door where we were bidden to remove our shoes, and a coarse
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: coloured robe was given to each of us to hide our splendid dress. The
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: robes having been put on, we were suffered to pass the door, and found
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: ourselves in a vast chamber in which were many noble men and some women,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: all standing and clad in coarse robes. At the far end of this chamber
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: was a gilded screen, and from behind it floated sounds of sweet music.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Now as we stood in the great chamber that was lighted with
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: sweet-smelling torches, many men advanced and greeted Guatemoc the
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: prince, and I noticed that all of them looked upon me curiously.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Presently a woman came and I saw that her beauty was great. She was
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: tall and stately, and beneath her rough outer robe splendidly attired
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: in worked and jewelled garments. Weary and bewildered as I was, her
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: loveliness seized me as it were in a vice, never before had I seen such
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: loveliness. For her eye was proud and full like the eye of a buck, her
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: curling hair fell upon her shoulders, and her features were very noble,
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: yet tender almost to sadness, though at times she could seem fierce
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: enough. This lady was yet in her first youth, perchance she may have
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: seen some eighteen years, but her shape was that of a full-grown woman
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: and most royal.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'Greeting, Guatemoc my cousin,' she said in a sweet voice; 'so you are
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: come at last. My royal father has awaited you for long and will ask
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: questions as to your delay. My sister your wife has wondered also why
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: you tarried.'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Now as she spoke I felt rather than saw that this lady was searching me
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: with her eyes.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'Greeting, Otomie my cousin,' answered the prince. 'I have been delayed
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: by the accidents of travel. Tobasco is far away, also my charge and
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: companion, Teule,' and he nodded towards me, 'met with an accident on
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: the road.'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'What was the accident?' she asked.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'Only this, that he saved me from the jaws of a puma at the risk of
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: his life when all the others fled from me, and was somewhat hurt in the
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: deed. He saved me thus--' and in few words he told the story.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: She listened and I saw that her eyes sparkled at the tale. When it was
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: done she spoke again, and this time to me.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'Welcome, Teule,' she said smiling. 'You are not of our people, yet my
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: heart goes out to such a man.' And still smiling she left us.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'Who is that great lady?' I asked of Guatemoc.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'That is my cousin Otomie, the princess of the Otomie, my uncle
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Montezuma's favourite daughter,' he answered. 'She likes you, Teule, and
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: that is well for you for many reasons. Hush!'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: As he spoke the screen at the far end of the chamber was drawn aside.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Beyond it a man sat upon a broidered cushion, who was inhaling the fumes
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: of the tobacco weed from a gilded pipe of wood after the Indian fashion.

text: THOMAS BECOMES A GOD
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Little did I, plain Thomas Wingfield, gentleman, know, when I rose that
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: morning, that before sunset I should be a god, and after Montezuma the
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Emperor, the most honoured man, or rather god, in the city of Mexico.
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: prince Guatemoc, I was led to the hall of justice, which was named the
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

text: hearing, which grew so warm that at length they appealed to the emperor

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: mortal enemy whom I have followed across the seas.'
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: 'How so?' I answered. 'What I have said, I have said. Otomie, you would
title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

text: Now when I heard this tale my anger overcame my reason, and I spoke
title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter
author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

author: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider)

title: Montezuma's Daughter

title: Montezuma's Daughter

text: Tlascalans, and as their allies had taken part in the war on the side of
